selfPermit(address,uint256,uint256,uint8.details: The `owner` is always msg.sender and the `spender` is always address(this).

params._deadline: A timestamp, the current blocktime must be less than or equal to this timestamp
params._r: Must produce valid secp256k1 signature from the holder along with `v` and `s`
params._s: Must produce valid secp256k1 signature from the holder along with `r` and `v`
params._token: The address of the token spent
params._v: Must produce valid secp256k1 signature from the holder along with `r` and `s`
params._value: The amount that can be spent of token

selfPermitIfNecessary(address,uint256,ui.details: The `owner` is always msg.sender and the `spender` is always address(this). Can be used instead of #selfPermit to prevent calls from failing due to a frontrun of a call to #selfPermit

params._deadline: A timestamp, the current blocktime must be less than or equal to this timestamp
params._r: Must produce valid secp256k1 signature from the holder along with `v` and `s`
params._s: Must produce valid secp256k1 signature from the holder along with `r` and `v`
params._token: The address of the token spent
params._v: Must produce valid secp256k1 signature from the holder along with `r` and `s`
params._value: The amount that can be spent of token

selfPermit(address,uint256,uint256,uint8.notice: Permits this contract to spend a given token from `msg.sender`

selfPermitIfNecessary(address,uint256,ui.notice: Permits this contract to spend a given token from `msg.sender`

documentation.text:
@title Self Permit
 @notice Functionality to call permit on any EIP-2612-compliant token for use in the route
